{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3141524,"name":"","username":"sciln24","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/6f9a4e/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-07T22:31:59.325Z","cooked":"

We are having problems with mecanum drive. Our motors appear to be turning in the wrong direction when trying to rotate the robot. The motors turn correctly going forward, backward, and strafing left and right, but not turning left and right.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-02-07T22:31:59.325Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":132,"reads":60,"readers_count":59,"score":672.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":426068,"topic_slug":"robotpy-mecanum-drive-robot-rotation","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/coordinate-system-for-mecanum-drive/426084/3","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Coordinate System for Mecanum Drive","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56900,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/robotpy-mecanum-drive-robot-rotation/426068/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3141563,"name":"Davo","username":"auscompgeek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/auscompgeek/{size}/9867_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-07T23:14:11.094Z","cooked":"

Are you sure your angles are the right way around? All the mecanum drive classes use the NWU axis convention, so rotations are anticlockwise positive.

A link to your code would also be helpful.

When you look at your drive base from the top, do the rollers on the wheels point in an X shape, or an O shape?

The rollers on the four wheels should each point in a direction that forms an X when viewed from the top.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-02-07T23:22:19.520Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":50,"readers_count":49,"score":25.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":426068,"topic_slug":"robotpy-mecanum-drive-robot-rotation","display_username":"Crystal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":11107,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Crystal is me (she/they)"},"post_url":"/t/robotpy-mecanum-drive-robot-rotation/426068/3","custom_user_title":"Crystal is me (she/they)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3141576,"name":"","username":"KGB","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/74df32/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-07T23:37:26.520Z","cooked":"

To clarify a bit of the original post, we were testing the robot up on blocks, observing the direction the wheels were moving.

We stripped our code down to just follow the simple mecanum example (only difference in the types of motor controllers and using an XBox controller):

github.com

robotpy/examples/blob/main/mecanum-drive/robot.py

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
    This is a demo program showing how to use Mecanum control with the
    MecanumDrive class.
"""

import wpilib
import wpilib.drive


class MyRobot(wpilib.TimedRobot):
    # Channels on the roboRIO that the motor controllers are plugged in to
    kFrontLeftChannel = 2
    kRearLeftChannel = 3
    kFrontRightChannel = 1
    kRearRightChannel = 0

    # The channel on the driver station that the joystick is connected to
    kJoystickChannel = 0
This file has been truncated. show original

We observed the following:

  • Y stick forward: all four wheels correctly move forward
  • Y stick backward: all four wheels correctly move backward
  • X stick left: correct wheel movements for strafing left (left side turning in, right side turning out)
  • X stick right: correct wheel movements for strafing right (right side turning in, left side turning out)
  • Z stick forward/backward: incorrect wheel movements for turning left or right (expected left side back & right side forward or left side forward & right side backward; but saw different behavior – don’t recall if it was strafing or “both sides turning in / both sides turning out”)

We are on the original robotpy 2023 release, not the most recent robotpy 2023 release.

Have others successfully used robotpy 2023 with mecanum drive? Is it possible there was a bug in mecanum in the initial robotpy 2023 release? (we will test on the most recent version when we are next in the lab and have an opportunity to upgrade)

KGB:

Is it possible there was a bug in mecanum in the initial robotpy 2023 release?

While it is technically possible that there is a bug, most bugs in RobotPy tend to fall into two categories: we forgot to include a method/class, or something crashes when it shouldn’t. However, it is possible that WPILib changed something and we forgot to update our example (and if you find that to be the case, please send a PR with fixes our way!).

frc-docs covers the mechanics of mecanum + code examples, including for python: Using the WPILib Classes to Drive your Robot — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

Note that the article is out of date regarding axes convention for mecanum: Axis conventions documentation incorrect for Mecanum Drive. Still states it is NED, rather than NWU as listed in changes for 2023. · Issue #2134 · wpilibsuite/frc-docs · GitHub

The WPILibJ/C examples and API docs were updated for this, I’m not sure about RobotPy.

virtuald:

it is possible that WPILib changed something and we forgot to update our example

Someone did update our example, but only partially. The example is fixed to match whatever is in the C++/Java example:

    def teleopPeriodic(self):
        self.robotDrive.driveCartesian(
            -self.stick.getY(),
            -self.stick.getX(),
            -self.stick.getZ(),
        )

Edit: … lol, the C++/Java examples have inconsistent comments
